name: Ziyuan-3-04
location_str: LC-9 @ Taiyuan Satellite Launch Center, CHN
description: The ZY-3 (Ziyuan-3, 'Resource-3') series represents China's first high-resolution, stereoscopic mapping satellites for civilian use.  The second satellite is managed by the Satellite Surveying and Mapping Application Center (SASMAC).  The imaging payload consists of a three-line camera array and a multispectral imager.  The three-line panchromatic camera array to acquire stereoscopic imagery consists of three telescopic cameras with one oriented to the nadir and the other two each offset by 22° forward and backward in flight direction. rocket_fact: A rocket launch is essentially a continuous controlled explosion that lasts for about eight minutes.
